libraries.name: SD
libraries.author: Arduino, SparkFun
libraries.sentence: Enables reading and writing on SD cards. For all Arduino boards.
libraries.paragraph: Once an SD memory card is connected to the SPI interfare of the Arduino board you are enabled to create files and read/write on them. You can also move through directories on the SD card.

libraries.name: Firmata
libraries.author: Firmata Developers
libraries.sentence: Enables the communication with computer apps using a standard serial protocol. For all Arduino boards.
libraries.paragraph: The Firmata library implements the Firmata protocol for communicating with software on the host computer. This allows you to write custom firmware without having to create your own protocol and objects for the programming environment that you are using.

libraries.name: Servo
libraries.author: Michael Margolis, Arduino
libraries.sentence: Allows Arduino boards to control a variety of servo motors. For all Arduino boards.
libraries.paragraph:
This library can control a great number of servos.
It makes careful use of timers: the library can control 12 servos using only 1 timer.
On the Arduino Due you can control up to 60 servos.

libraries.name: Stepper
libraries.author: Arduino
libraries.sentence: Allows Arduino boards to control a variety of stepper motors. For all Arduino boards.
libraries.paragraph: This library allows you to control unipolar or bipolar stepper motors. To use it you will need a stepper motor, and the appropriate hardware to control it.

libraries.name: WiFi
libraries.author: Arduino
libraries.sentence: Enables network connection (local and Internet) using the Arduino WiFi shield. For all Arduino boards.
libraries.paragraph: With this library you can instantiate Servers, Clients and send/receive UDP packets through WiFi. The shield can connect either to open or encrypted networks (WEP, WPA). The IP address can be assigned statically or through a DHCP. The library can also manage DNS.

libraries.name: Bridge
libraries.author: Arduino
libraries.sentence: Enables the communication between the Linux processor and the AVR. For Arduino Yún and TRE only.
libraries.paragraph: The Bridge library feature: access to the shared storage, run and manage linux processes, open a remote console, access to the linux file system, including the SD card, enstablish http clients or servers.

libraries.name: Robot IR Remote
libraries.author: Arduino
libraries.sentence: Allows controlling the Arduino Robot via an IR remote control. For Arduino Robot only.

libraries.name: Robot Control
libraries.author: Arduino
libraries.sentence: Enables easy access to the controls of the Arduino Robot Control board. For Arduino Robot only.
libraries.paragraph: The Arduino robot is made by two independent boards. The Control Board is the top board of the Arduino Robot, with this library you can easily write sketches to control the robot.

libraries.name: SpacebrewYun
libraries.author: Julio Terra
libraries.sentence: Enables the communication between interactive objects using WebSockets. For Arduino Yún only.
libraries.paragraph: This library was developed to enable you to easily connect the Arduino Yún to Spacebrew. To learn more about Spacebrew visit Spacebrew.cc

libraries.name: Ethernet
libraries.author: Arduino
libraries.sentence: Enables network connection (local and Internet) using the Arduino Ethernet board or shield. For all Arduino boards.
libraries.paragraph: With this library you can use the Arduino Ethernet (shield or board) to connect to Internet. The library provides both Client and server functionalities. The library permits you to connect to a local network also with DHCP and to resolve DNS.

libraries.name: Esplora
libraries.author: Arduino
libraries.sentence: Grants easy access to the various sensors and actuators of the Esplora. For Arduino Esplora only.
libraries.paragraph: The sensors available on the board are:2-Axis analog joystick with center push-button,4 push-buttons,microphone, light sensor, temperature sensor, 3-axis accelerometer, 2 TinkerKit input connectors.</br>The actuators available on the board are: bright RGB LED, piezo buzzer, 2 TinkerKit output connectors.

libraries.name: GSM
libraries.author: Arduino
libraries.sentence: Enables GSM/GRPS network connection using the Arduino GSM Shield. For all Arduino boards BUT Arduino DUE.
libraries.paragraph: Use this library to make/receive voice calls, to send and receive SMS with the Quectel M10 GSM module.</br>This library also allows you to connect to internet through the GPRS networks. You can either use web Clients and Servers.</br>

libraries.name: Robot Motor
libraries.author: Arduino
libraries.sentence: Enables easy access to the motors of the Arduino Robot Motor board. For Arduino Robot only.

libraries.name: Temboo
libraries.author: Temboo
libraries.sentence: This library enables calls to Temboo, a platform that connects Arduino boards to 100+ APIs, databases, code utilities and more.
libraries.paragraph: Use this library to connect your Arduino board to Temboo, making it simple to interact with a vast array of web-based resources and services.

libraries.name: LiquidCrystal
libraries.author: Arduino, Adafruit
libraries.sentence: Allows communication with alphanumerical liquid crystal displays (LCDs). For all Arduino boards.
libraries.paragraph: This library allows an Arduino board to control LiquidCrystal displays (LCDs) based on the Hitachi HD44780 (or a compatible) chipset, which is found on most text-based LCDs. The library works with in either 4 or 8 bit mode (i.e. using 4 or 8 data lines in addition to the rs, enable, and, optionally, the rw control lines).

libraries.name: TFT
libraries.author: Arduino, Adafruit
libraries.sentence: Allows drawing text, images, and shapes on the Arduino TFT graphical display. For all Arduino boards.
libraries.paragraph: This library is compatible with most of the TFT display based on the ST7735 chipset
